data.title: Add standard Eclipse files to root .gitignore
data.body:
Please ensure you have given all the following requested information in your report.

#### Issue details
Started working with the libgdx as a contributor, noticed that the .gitignore for the repo is missing the standard Eclipse working files.

#### Reproduction steps/code
Check out the repo, open the project[s] in Eclipse.

Should add the following to the .gitignore

# Eclipse
.classpath
.project
.settings/

Or optionally the longer list at http://www.bmchild.com/2012/06/git-ignore-for-java-eclipse-project.html

LMK if you want me to do a PR for this - it's kind of a top level file and I don't want to blow anything up, but happy to submit if that is easier.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
all, or 1.9.6-SNAPSOT

#### Stacktrace
n/a

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [X] Android
- [X] iOS (robovm)
- [X] iOS (MOE)
- [X] HTML/GWT
- [X] Windows
- [X] Linux
- [X] MacOS

data.title: [Feature request] create audio from array of samples
data.body:
hello

it will be very nice  to have a method
```java
Sound newSoundFromSamples(float[] samples);
```
in the Audio class,

I know AudioDevice has a writeSamples method that can be used for procedural sound, but i doesn't work very well, i played the demo "AudioDeviceTest" and the audio was a bit choppy  

I think  the method i propose would be much better

data.title: Prevent potential crashes in IOSApplication due to audio being unavailable
data.body:
I am seeing several `EXC_BAD_ACCESS KERN_INVALID_ADDRESS` crash logs happening when `OALSimpleAudio.sharedInstance().setUseHardwareIfAvailable(false);` is called. 

The issue seems to be that the shared instance of `OALSimpleAudio` is sometimes not available and returns `null`. There is already a null-check in https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/14d89225ae26afc1cc7f52e986e566bf19425275/backends/gdx-backend-robovm/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/iosrobovm/IOSAudio.java#L34 for the very same reason.

This PR adds the same checks to `didBecomeActive` and `willEnterForeground` for the `OALAudioSession` and `OALSimpleAudio` instances. 
I also made a very small change to robovm `IOSNet` to accompany the latest changes to moe `IOSNet`.

data.title: addActorBefore()/addActorAfter() should not be used with Table
data.body:
Please ensure you have given all the following requested information in your report.

#### Issue details
[Table](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/db805953849780161df7c1fb96f81248c19cff44/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/ui/Table.java) inherits (indirectly) from [Group](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/Group.java), which means Table has the following three methods for adding a child node:

* [add(Actor)](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/db805953849780161df7c1fb96f81248c19cff44/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/ui/Table.java#L194)
* [addActorBefore(Actor, Actor)](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/db805953849780161df7c1fb96f81248c19cff44/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/Group.java#L290)
* [addActorAfter(Actor, Actor)](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/db805953849780161df7c1fb96f81248c19cff44/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/scenes/scene2d/Group.java#L304)

A developer using Scene2d *might* reasonably assume that all of these will work, when in fact, only the first method works -- the other two methods will execute and return normally, but will not layout the newly-added actor correctly (it'll be laid out underneath the last child of the Table).

#### Reproduction steps/code
_Even if you think your issue is trivial to reproduce, please supply a [SSCCE](http://sscce.org/) that demonstrates your issue.  This saves time on our end, and makes it much more likely that your issue will be fixed.
You can find barebones templates [here](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Getting-help)_

I'm not sure this requires repro steps or code. Let me know if you want them.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
LibGDX 1.9.5, but current mainline appears affected as well.

#### Stacktrace
No stacktrace.

#### Affected platforms
All.

#### What I'm looking for

I'm looking for anything that would have saved me an hour of fiddling with `pack()` and `invalidateHierarchy()` just to find that these methods just don't work presently. I'd be happy with any of the following:

1. Override `addActor{Before|After}()` in Table so they work as expected.
2. Override `addActor{Before|After}()` in Table and make them throw an exception.
3. Override `addActor{Before|After}()` in Table and have it call `super`, but *also* annotate the method as `@Deprecated` with a reason why.

I can see that the [documentation](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Table#inserting-cells) does mention this exact issue, near the very bottom, but I didn't see this and I suspect others might miss it as well.

data.title: Can not play 2 Music instances at the same time on Android
Pixel Stuttering when rotating an object and fixating the camera to one point
MeshBuilder error using Short.MAX_VALUE vertices
data.body:
MeshBuilder will give an error when trying to use Short.MAX_VALUE vertices in a mesh.  This means meshes created using MeshBuilder can only use (Short.MAX_VALUE - 1) total vertices.

A use case requiring the change would be a mesh pooling implementation using MeshBuilder currently needs to check against the size of (Short.MAX_VALUE - 1) instead of the actual number of vertices allocated in the mesh.

data.title: [JSON] Error parsing json that contains brackets in strings
data.body:
Please ensure you have given all the following requested information in your report.

#### Issue details
Can't parse a json with brackets in strings like this: 

```kotlin
JsonReader().parse(Gdx.files.internal("data/json/strings.json"))
```

```json
{
  "AbilityBar.levelLabel": "Lvl. {level}",
}
```

#### Reproduction steps/code
Try to parse the json code above

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.6-SNAPSHOT

data.title: Closing the application window resets desktop color tinting from redshift
Added appendLine
Update documentation about using Scala + SBT
data.body:
Sorry for not following the format. But this is not a bug. Only about documentation.

If anyone is interested in using SBT + Scala with MobiDevelop's fork of RoboVM, then one should use

1. this fork of sbt-robovm https://github.com/molikto/sbt-robovm, you need too publish-local this plugin.
2. this fork of project templete https://github.com/Darkyenus/libgdx-sbt-project.g8 and setting sbt-robovm and RoboVM version to 2.3.0. Then it will resolve to the plugin publish-local'ed

Scala + Gradle works but I found IntelliJ IDEA is extremely buggy with this combination

data.title: GWT build will not load without Flash On Some Browsers
data.body:
Please ensure you have given all the following requested information in your report.

#### Issue details
When trying to run on a fresh Ubuntu install with Firefox, the game does not load, and an error appears in the console. (in stacktrace section)

I even have preferFlash to false:

```
public GwtApplicationConfiguration getConfig () {
        	GwtApplicationConfiguration config = new GwtApplicationConfiguration(getWindowInnerWidth(), getWindowInnerHeight());
        	config.preferFlash = false;
            return config;
        }
```

This appears: 

![](https://i.stack.imgur.com/yao56.png)


#### Reproduction steps/code
Running a game on Firefox on fresh Ubuntu. Here is a link to my test game in case you need it: http://ajayinkingston.com/splats/

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.5 and 1.9.4 seem to have this issue.

#### Stacktrace

```
SoundManager: No Flash detected. Trying HTML5-only mode. soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
SoundManager V2.97a.20130512 (AS3/Flash 9) + HTML5 audio soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
SoundManager 2: soundManager: Fatal error: Flash is needed to play some required formats, but is not available. soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
SoundManager 2 HTML5 support: mp3 = false (using flash), mp4 = false (using flash), ogg = true, opus = true, wav = true soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
soundManager: No Flash response within expected time. Likely causes: Flash blocked or JS-Flash security error. soundmanager2-jsmin.js:32:357
soundManager: Waiting indefinitely for Flash (will recover if unblocked)...
```

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [x] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: scale is always = UIScreen.mainScreen().nativeScale()
data.body:
#### Issue details
Just looking at the internal code of moe-ios and I found this line that seems not correct 

float scale = (float)(getIosVersion() >= 8 ? UIScreen.mainScreen().nativeScale() : UIScreen.mainScreen().nativeScale());

This is line 138 in IOSApplication.java

Note : that this has no effect on me so far, but the developer have the same code (UIScreen.mainScreen().nativeScale()) in both parts of this condition !
#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.5


#### Please select the affected platforms

data.title: Add topics to Github repo
data.body:
Github [recently added topics](https://github.com/blog/2309-introducing-topics) and it would be nice to add these to the github repo to help people find `libgdx`. Some ideas:

- game-engine
- multi-platform
- opensource

data.title: Run desktop version
data.body:
#### Issue details
When I run desktop version - app do not compile and run

#### Reproduction steps/code
I use last version of libGDX.
This is empty project (I use gdx-setup.jar).
But after I run desktop config - I get message "Process finished with exit code -1073740791 (0xC0000409)".
In folder \desktop\build\libs size of file desktop-1.0.jar 2 kb!!!

But if I run gradle desktop dist - size of desktop-1.0.jar ~6 mb and it can be run.

Desktop configuration:
![2017-01-31 23 03 56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3989836/22484433/13b6f682-e80a-11e6-867a-14c017501bce.png)

Please, help me! I do not understand, why not start a desktop project..
PS sorry for my English.

data.title: [NVIDIA] Latest 378.49 driver is broken!

libGDX games refuse to run

#### Reproduction steps/code
Try to run your game with the latest Nvidia driver installed

" They really screwed up with this one. Even Direct3D 9 and 11 applications do not work anymore if being renamed to "java.exe" and started as "java". "

It's not an libGDX issue, but i think everyone should be aware of this

data.title: LwjglAWTCanvas: Fix for flickering cursor during swing/javafx drag & drop
data.body:
Every render frame, canvas.setCursor(cursor); would be called:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/lwjgl/LwjglAWTCanvas.java#L254

When you have an application using swing or javafx drag & drop features, the above will cause the mouse-cursor to flicker during dnd.

LwjglCanvas suffers from the same issue:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/9b8f20b2d0e96e53f0f2b98dc8f6131c810aae71/backends/gdx-backend-lwjgl/src/com/badlogic/gdx/backends/lwjgl/LwjglCanvas.java#L216

I'm honestly not sure why this was done every frame..
@NathanSweet could you please give some insight?

data.title: Update libgdx-utils 3rd party extension
data.body: new release to fix [incompatibility](https://bitbucket.org/dermetfan/libgdx-utils/issues/18/not-compatible-with-gwt-html5-on-libgdx#comment-32858945) with libGDX 1.9.5

data.title: Automatically downloaded native Android libraries incompatible with Nexus 5
data.body:
Please ensure you have given all the following requested information in your report.

#### Issue details
I've downloaded the source code and ran ant -f fetch.xml, then ant, and then opened the project in eclipse. Then I tried running the tests in an emulator and everything is working fine, but on my Nexus 5 Marshmallow it crashes with error. If I want to build libgdx, including the native files, how should I proceed? There is also a thread in the forums opened about this: http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=25695&p=101372#p101372

Initially I thought I did something wrong but investigating further it seems that the automatically downloaded libgdx native libraries are build with an older and probably buggy ndk version. Or the latest version introduces new bugs, I don't know.

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.5 master branch latest
#### Stacktrace
01-30 12:56:48.101: E/AndroidRuntime(20651): Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: dlopen failed: cannot locate symbol "__aeabi_memclr" referenced by "/data/app/com.badlogic.gdx.tests.android-1/lib/arm/libgdx.so"...

#### Please select the affected platforms
- [x ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
- [ ] HTML/GWT
- [ ] Windows
- [ ] Linux
- [ ] MacOS

data.title: improve gitignore template fix libgdx/libgdx#4560
data.body:
as discussed in #4560, here is the fix (maybe not the final fix).

I'm not really confident with these modifications because I'm not using all OS/IDE/Targets. I'm using eclipse on linux and mostly target desktop and android so I think this fix should be validated by more contributors.

Has you can see, what I've done so far is : 
* add leading slashes and full path to avoid unwanted ignore.
* removed some duplicates : for instance html/war/WEB-INF/deploy/ is useless with /html/war
* removed some IMO useless : tmp/
* move local.properties to gradle section

Note that I could use single wildcard instead of path for every sub project (for instance /*/dist/) but it could conflicts with some project specific folder structure.

@Tom-Ski : I don't really understand why you want to keep just one big file instead of dispatching some parts in related sub projects. It would be cleaner way for many reasons : 
* make gitignore files more readable.
* avoid useless ignore when not targeting all platforms.
* easily manage sub folder renaming / moving.

Thanks to point me in the right direction in order to improve these changes.

data.title: [GWT] error in gdx.gwt.xml
data.body:
I cat not compile gwt project. I add next lines for compile without errors

exclude name="utils/DataBuffer.java"
Reason: change name for overrided member

exclude name="utils/PauseableThread.java"
Reason: wait() and notifyAll() is undefined

exclude name="graphics/g3d/environment/SphericalHarmonics.java"
Reason: use Array.clone()

#### Version of LibGDX and/or relevant dependencies
1.9.5

- [ ] Android
- [ ] iOS (robovm)
- [ ] iOS (MOE)
